nio/MSSQLDelete.description: Creates a cursor object for an incoming signal and executes one command per signal.

credentials.title: Connection Credentials
credentials.description: UID and PWD used for database authentication

database.title: Database
database.description: name of databse to connect to

mars.title: Enable Multiple Active Result Sets
mars.description: Enable MARS for SQL database connections

default.description: A signal with the number of rows deleted

nio/MSSQLInsert.description: Creates a cursor object for every list of signals, and executes one query per signal. Changes are committed automatically for each list of signals. When changes are committed, all active cursors (i.e. lists of signals) for that connection (i.e. instance of the block) are committed simultaneously. To avoid this behavior use multiple instances of the block.

credentials.title: Connection Credentials
credentials.description: UID and PWD used for database authentication

database.title: Database
database.description: name of database to connect to

mars.title: Enable Multiple Active Result Sets
mars.description: Enable MARS for SQL database connections

row.title: Row
row.description: record to be inserted as `{key: value}` pairs

default.description: A list of signals with one record to insert per signal
One signal per list of signals processed, with the attribute `inserted` containing the number of records inserted

nio/MSSQLQuery.description: Creates a cursor object for every list of signals, and executes one query per signal returning all matching records in a new list of signals.

credentials.description: UID and PWD used for database authentication

mars.title: Enable Multiple Active Result Sets
mars.description: Enable MARS for SQL database connections

No Results.description: One signal, with a return value null

Results.description: One signal per list of signals processed, with the attribute inserted containing the number of records inserted

nio/MSSQLUpdate.description: Creates a cursor object for every list of signals, and executes one update per signal
